summary: The 'Justice for Angel Families Act' aims to support families of victims killed by individuals who are in the US unlawfully, particularly those associated with criminal organizations or inadmissible under immigration law. It amends the Victims of Crime Act to include "angel families" in grant eligibility for expenses related to the crime.  It also establishes a Victims of Immigration Crime Engagement Office within the Department of Homeland Security to provide services to these families and compile reports on the impact of crimes committed by such individuals.
